counties.name: Alameda County
counties.impacts: Increased temperatures could reduce grape quality by accelerating ripening and affecting sugar-acid balance. Almonds may face yield reductions due to reduced chill hours and increased evapotranspiration.
counties.economic_risks: Potential loss of revenue from premium wine grape production; almond yield reductions could impact the local economy significantly.

counties.name: Butte County
counties.impacts: Heat stress may cause walnut and almond yield reductions. Rice, being water-intensive, could be impacted by water scarcity.
counties.economic_risks: Losses in nut production, a major economic driver. Potential decrease in rice output affecting both local and export markets.

counties.name: Fresno County
counties.impacts: Wide variability in impacts; stone fruits and grapes may face quality issues, while vegetables like tomatoes may experience yield drops.
counties.economic_risks: High due to the diverse and economically significant crop portfolio. Losses in citrus and stone fruit yields could be substantial.
adaptation_strategies: Exploring new crop varieties that are more heat-tolerant

counties.name: Imperial County
counties.impacts: Extreme heat events could reduce yields and quality, particularly for cool-season crops like celery and carrots.
counties.economic_risks: Risk of crop failures and reduced marketability due to quality issues.

counties.name: Kern County
counties.impacts: Almonds and pistachios are highly vulnerable to temperature extremes and water shortages.
counties.economic_risks: High economic impact due to the significance of nut crops in the region.
adaptation_strategies: Breeding and adopting heat-resistant crop varieties

counties.name: Kings County
counties.impacts: High temperatures could reduce cotton yields and quality. Grapes and tomatoes may suffer from sunburn and reduced quality.
counties.economic_risks: Losses in high-value crops like grapes and almonds.

counties.name: Los Angeles County
counties.impacts: Urban heat islands exacerbate temperature extremes, affecting fruit quality and yield.
counties.economic_risks: Potential revenue loss in local wine and fresh fruit markets.

counties.name: Madera County
counties.impacts: Water scarcity and high temperatures are primary concerns, potentially reducing yield and quality across all crops.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, as the region is a major producer of almonds and grapes.

counties.name: Merced County
counties.impacts: Increased risk of frost damage in early spring due to variable temperatures. Heat stress could also affect summer crops.
counties.economic_risks: Potential revenue loss from high-value crops like almonds.

counties.name: Monterey County
counties.impacts: Increased temperatures can reduce the quality of cool-season crops like broccoli and lettuce. Artichokes and strawberries are also sensitive to temperature extremes.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, as Monterey County is a major producer of lettuce and strawberries. Quality degradation due to heat stress may lead to reduced prices and economic losses.
adaptation_strategies: Shifting planting schedules to cooler periods
Investing in cooler climate crop varieties

counties.name: Napa County
counties.impacts: Warming temperatures can accelerate grape ripening, affecting the balance of sugars and acids. Changes in precipitation patterns could also stress vineyards.
counties.economic_risks: High due to the premium value of Napa wines. Climate change poses a risk to both the volume and quality of wine produced.
adaptation_strategies: Transitioning to grape varieties more tolerant of warmer temperatures

counties.name: Riverside County
counties.impacts: High temperatures and variable precipitation are challenging for crop production. Grapes and citrus are particularly vulnerable to heat stress.
counties.economic_risks: Considerable, especially for high-value crops like grapes used in wine production and fresh citrus.

counties.name: Sacramento County
counties.impacts: Risks from both high temperatures and potential water shortages. Grapes may suffer from heat stress, affecting both quality and yield.
counties.economic_risks: Substantial due to the diversity and economic significance of crops grown in the county. Reduced water availability could lead to lower yields and higher production costs.

counties.name: San Joaquin County
counties.impacts: Vulnerable to heatwaves and droughts, which can reduce yields and quality across a range of crops.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, especially in the almond and wine industries, which are major contributors to the local economy.
adaptation_strategies: Adopting advanced agricultural practices like precision farming

counties.name: San Luis Obispo County
counties.impacts: Increasing temperatures pose a risk, particularly to avocados and grapes, which are sensitive to heat.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, especially in the premium wine and avocado markets.
adaptation_strategies: Optimizing water use through efficient irrigation systems
Potentially transitioning to more heat-resistant crop varieties

counties.name: Santa Barbara County
counties.impacts: Increasing temperatures and water scarcity pose risks, particularly to cool-season crops like broccoli and lettuce.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, especially for high-value crops like grapes and strawberries.

counties.name: Santa Clara County
counties.impacts: Increasing urbanization and rising temperatures are major concerns.
counties.economic_risks: High, especially where urban expansion threatens agricultural land.
adaptation_strategies: Investing in sustainable water management practices

counties.name: Santa Cruz County
counties.impacts: Increasing temperatures and water scarcity could impact crop yields and quality.
counties.economic_risks: Moderate, especially if water shortages lead to reduced irrigation and crop yields.

counties.name: Solano County
counties.impacts: Heat stress and water scarcity are significant concerns.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, particularly for the wine and nut industries.

counties.name: Sonoma County
counties.impacts: Warming temperatures can alter grape ripening times, affecting wine quality. Apple production may also be impacted by temperature extremes.
counties.economic_risks: High, especially if changes in climate conditions lead to reduced quality and yield in wine production.

counties.name: Stanislaus County
counties.impacts: Vulnerable to climate change, particularly in nut and fruit crops.
counties.economic_risks: High, given the importance of these crops to the local economy.
adaptation_strategies: Developing and adopting drought-resistant crop varieties

counties.name: Tulare County
counties.impacts: Significant risks from increasing temperatures and water scarcity.
counties.economic_risks: Substantial, as Tulare County is a major agricultural hub.

counties.name: Ventura County
counties.impacts: Increasing temperatures and potential water shortages pose significant challenges.
counties.economic_risks: Significant, as Ventura County is a leading producer of avocados and strawberries.
adaptation_strategies: Exploring the cultivation of more heat-tolerant varieties
